message: Let's split it 50/50, Bob. No need to negotiate further.
You can't be serious with a 50/50 split. I'm offering you a fair 7/3 ratio.
You said 7/3 was fair? I'll give you a better deal than that. 60/40 in my favor, but still a decent split.
You think 60/40 is a decent split? I'll give you a chance to reconsider with a 55/45 split. It's still a good deal for you.
You're getting desperate, Bob. I'm taking a bigger share, but it's still a decent offer. Don't push your luck.
You're really pushing your luck now. I'm not going to let you get away with a 7/3 split. I'll give you a 60/40 split, but I'm not budging any further.
You're not budging, Bob? Fine. I'll take a bigger share. Don't say I didn't warn you.
You're really trying to take me for a ride now. I'm not going to let you walk away with 80% of the money. I'm sticking to my guns on a 7/3 split, no exceptions.
You're not serious about the 7/3 split, Bob. I'm taking 90% of the money. It's time to accept or walk away.
You're really testing my patience now. I'm not going to let you take 90% of the money. I'm making a final offer: 80/20. Take it or leave it.
You've had plenty of chances, Bob. This is my final offer. Take the last dollar or walk away with nothing.
Fine, you want to play it this way? I'll take the 50/50 split you offered in round 1. I'd rather have half the money than nothing.
